channel.title: Freeform Radio, Artist interviews on Outsight Radio Hours
channel.itunes:subtitle: Bold & New music from outside the Mainstream
channel.itunes:author: Outsight Radio Hours
channel.itunes:summary: Freeform, eclectic Internet radio. Full playlists at: http://www.new-sounds.com/playlists/playlist.html
channel.description: A freeform podcast that has been online as a part of eclectic Internet radio since 1999. Each week features new and non-mainstream music with a featured artist and interview guest.

image.title: Freeform Radio, Artist interviews on Outsight Radio Hours

channel.itunes:keywords: interviews,new releases,Dr. Music,radio free detroit,suzanne ciani,bill anderson,churchwood,wiyos,new music,pirate radio,carol teegardin,zappa,mothers,billy james,ant-bee,larry o. dean,timothy sellers,artichoke,bakelite 78,jay allen sanford,todd loren

item.title: Churchwood: Outsight #664

item.author: outsight@usa.net (Outsight Radio Hours)
item.itunes:subtitle: The featured artist is Churchwood and we feature a lot of music from the group’s label Saustex. The interview guest is the group’s guitarist Bill Anderson.

item.title: Best of Radio Free Detroit, Vol. 2. Circa 1989
item.itunes:author: Radio Free Detroit
item.author: outsight@usa.net (Outsight Radio Hours)
item.itunes:subtitle: Collection of Radio Free Detroit segments, circa 1989 when the pirate radio station was at is peak. I was on-air personality Frank K.
item.description: Collection of Radio Free Detroit segments, circa 1989 when the pirate radio station was at is peak. I was on-air personality Frank K.
item.itunes:summary: Mojo Nixon & Skid Roper "Pirate Radio" DJ Chatter #1 Lenny Bruce "The Bust" Instrumental DJ Chatter #2 Smash Hit of the Week Bush at War Rebel Radio Collective Speaks Henry Rollins "Do It" Gladys espouses Togetherness Bob Marley "Burnin' and Lootin'" Design Engineers 'Angry Voices Need a Place to Shout' DJ Chatter #3 Ornette Coleman "Friends and Neighbors" Prince Street Dread Love Phil Ochs "I Ain't Marching Any More" Melvin Bongwater Women's Collective talk over Janis Joplin "Bye, Bye Baby" Frank K's 'Three Women' poem is cut off Primus "Mr. Knowitall" Frank K reads his poem 'Rights' Prong "Prove you Wrong" Fighting Back on the Job Traffic and Weather "Syringes on the Jersey Shore" Every 15 Seconds Reading from "Daughters of Copper Woman" by Anne Cameron Jazz interlude Reading some William Burroughs Um ... And "Pirates Anthem" with WWJ News Report
